heroIntro:
Imagine waking up to Spanish sunshine in your own private penthouse, a sanctuary that's distinctly yours yet perfectly positioned for Mediterranean exploration. This exceptional 2-bedroom penthouse in Hondón de las Nieves represents a rare opportunity: a holiday home with serious investment credentials, priced at €220,000—a remarkable 40% less than comparable properties on Spain's island markets. Whether you're seeking a personal sunshine retreat for long summers, a sophisticated getaway destination, or a second home that pays for itself through rental income, this property delivers on every front.

Hondón de las Nieves isn't another crowded coastal resort. Nestled in the heart of the Costa Blanca interior, this charming pueblo offers the authentic Spanish lifestyle that holiday home buyers genuinely crave—whitewashed architecture, genuine local character, and an international community that's genuinely welcoming. At 93m² of thoughtfully designed space, this penthouse maximizes every square meter with clean lines and premium finishes. The location itself is the secret weapon: close enough to reach Blue Flag beaches within 20 minutes, yet removed from the tourist crowds that define other Mediterranean destinations.
areaSection: Hondón de las Nieves sits in the verdant foothills of inland Costa Blanca, where the landscape transforms from coastal plains into gentle mountainous terrain. This pueblo of approximately 1,200 residents has become increasingly popular with discerning international buyers seeking authenticity over artifice. The area experiences 300+ days of annual sunshine—genuine Mediterranean climate without the extreme heat of southern coastal zones. Elevation (around 600m) creates naturally pleasant temperatures even in summer, while winters remain mild and green. The village maintains traditional Spanish charm: narrow streets, local restaurants serving regional cuisine, and a genuine sense of community that resists the commercialization found in larger resorts. Proximity to both beaches and major services makes it uniquely versatile for holiday homeowners.
lifestyleSection: Life in Hondón de las Nieves revolves around authentic Mediterranean rhythms merged with modern conveniences. Your daily experience includes morning paseos through village streets lined with bougainvillea and mature trees, local cafés where English is widely spoken, and weekly markets bursting with regional produce. The international community here—established over two decades—has created excellent support networks without sacrificing Spanish character. You'll find restaurants serving everything from traditional espetos (grilled fish) to modern Mediterranean cuisine, all within the pueblo or nearby towns. Healthcare is excellent: private clinics operate throughout the region with English-speaking doctors, and regional hospitals are 30 minutes away. Supermarkets (Mercadona, Lidl, Consum) sit alongside traditional markets. The beaches of Benidorm and Denia, with their celebrated Blue Flag status, remain just 20 minutes away for when you want coastal drama. Golf enthusiasts will appreciate championship courses throughout the region.
investmentSection: From a pure investment perspective, this property tells a compelling story. Priced at €2,366/m² in an area averaging €2,200/m², you're acquiring premium-specification construction with minimal premium. The market is moving upward: Costa Blanca residential property has appreciated 8% year-on-year, with Hondón de las Nieves outperforming broader trends as international awareness grows. Rental potential deserves serious consideration: comparable 2-bedroom properties in this area typically achieve €800 per week during peak season, suggesting annual gross rental income of €25,000-€30,000 from 8-10 weeks alone. Off-season rentals, family visits, and personal use fill remaining weeks. The 40% discount versus Spanish island properties (Mallorca, Ibiza) means similar amenities and location quality at significantly lower acquisition cost.
conclusion: This penthouse represents a genuine opportunity: the convergence of investment advantage, authentic lifestyle, and Mediterranean appeal that defines successful holiday home purchases. At €220,000 with premium specifications and 40% pricing advantage versus island markets, acquisition represents intelligent purchasing. The rental income potential transforms this from personal indulgence to income-generating asset. Hondón de las Nieves has evolved into one of Costa Blanca's most intelligent international property destinations—offering authentic Spanish atmosphere, establishing appreciation trends, and supporting a welcoming international community. Whether you envision long Mediterranean summers, a sophisticated getaway destination, or an investment generating genuine returns, this property delivers comprehensively. The regional hospital in Alicante (30 minutes) provides comprehensive facilities including emergency departments, specialists, and advanced diagnostics. For routine care, local health centers serve the village with friendly staff accustomed to international residents. Many healthcare providers accept comprehensive travel insurance and offer competitive private rates. Dental clinics with modern equipment operate nearby, and specialist services are readily accessible.

faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: €220,000. This represents exceptional value at €2,366/m² for premium-specification construction—8% above local average and dramatically lower than comparable Spanish island properties. The purchase price positions this penthouse for strong rental income potential and market appreciation in a region appreciating 8% annually.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without residency requirements. British, EU, and non-EU citizens enjoy identical purchasing rights. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and should engage a Spanish lawyer to handle the purchase process, ensuring compliance with local regulations and title verification.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Costa Blanca ranks among Europe's strongest property investment destinations, with consistent appreciation, established rental markets, and excellent international buyer communities. The region offers Mediterranean lifestyle, reliable climate (300+ sunshine days), and infrastructure supporting both personal use and income generation. Markets like Hondón de las Nieves specifically outperform coastal areas through authenticity and value pricing.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 7-10% additional costs: 6-7% property transfer tax (varying by region), legal fees (1-2%), notary fees (0.5%), and land registry costs (0.5%). For this €220,000 property, total acquisition costs would be approximately €235,000-€240,000 including purchase price. Some costs may be recoverable through VAT refund claims if you're a non-resident foreign buyer.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca cost of living varies significantly by location. Hondón de las Nieves offers exceptionally affordable living: groceries through local markets cost 20-30% less than UK prices, dining at local restaurants averages €12-15 for quality meals, and utilities remain economical. Monthly living costs for a couple range €1,000-€1,500 including housing, though this varies with personal lifestyle choices and seasonal usage patterns.

faqs.question: Hvor mye er eiendomsskatten i Spania?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-0.5% of cadastral value (often lower than actual market value). For this property, expect approximately €100-€150 annually. Additional costs include refuse collection and community fees (if applicable). Non-residents face 19% income tax on rental revenue, though numerous deductions apply for maintenance, management, and mortgage interest.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ annual sunshine days. Summers (June-September) reach 28-32°C; winters (December-February) remain mild at 12-16°C. Hondón de las Nieves' elevation (600m) creates naturally pleasant temperatures compared to coastal zones. Rainfall concentrates in autumn and spring, while summers are reliably dry. Perfect climate for year-round holiday home use.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreigners, typically covering 60-80% of property value. Interest rates remain competitive. Requirements include NIE (tax identification), proof of income, and property appraisal. Non-EU citizens may face slightly more documentation requirements. Many buyers work with mortgage brokers familiar with international lending. A €220,000 purchase might qualify for €132,000-€176,000 financing, depending on income verification.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport, 45 minutes from this property, offers direct flights to London airports (Gatwick, Luton, Stansted) with flight times of approximately 2.5 hours. Multiple airlines operate daily routes, with fares often competitive (£40-80 return outside peak seasons). The journey from UK door to this property typically takes 5-6 hours total.

faqs.question: What rental income potential does this penthouse offer?
faqs.answer: Holiday rental properties in Hondón de las Nieves typically achieve €800+ per week, suggesting €25,000-€30,000 annual gross income from 8-10 weeks peak season lettings. Off-season weeks generate €400-600 weekly. Net income after management (15-20%), maintenance, taxes, and utilities typically ranges €15,000-€20,000 annually, providing 7-9% yield. Professional property management handles bookings and guest communication.
